intro: Microchilus malmei, commonly known as the Malme's rock cress, is a small flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in areas of Kazakhstan and Russia. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, alpine environments. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and it produces small, elongated pods that contain several seeds. Microchilus malmei is often found in open, sunny habitats at high altitudes.
